entry.title: PDE team does cloning
entry.content:
In case you wonder why the PDE team is so productive, have a look at this image:

In expectation of BugDay July 2007, the PDE team have cloned Chris Aniszczyk!

If you want to lend a helping hand on BugDay, do not hesitate - it's easy. The teams have selected some bugs which  are easy to solve. Browse this list, claim a bug and provide a patch. Or, if you do not have time for debugging code and creating patches: triage some bugs.

entry.title: A message for you from earth
entry.content: Alex Blewitt from EclipseZone posted a news entry earlier the day regarding the popularity of EclipseZone. In his post, he featured a service called GeoGreeting. GeoGreeting is using Google Maps to generate texts. Go and have a look yourself, it's cool.

entry.title: The Free Software Song
entry.content: Looking around on youtube for "software", I found this little gem:

entry.title: Summer splash
entry.content: If you're feeling this summer is way to hot and need to cool down try out this cute flash game. Great music, nice graphics and thrilling action - cool! Would you dare jumping down a 10 meter platform like this in real life?

entry.title: The Daily .WAV
entry.content: Looking for some cools sounds to spice up your Windows? Have a look at The20Daily20.WAV, they've got plenty of cool sounds mainly from movies and TV shows. I found it because I was googling for a sounds featuring Marvin (the paranoid android from The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy). The Daily .WAV has quite some sounds from the "Guide" - get them here!
